Title: Spanish I
Description: Introductory Spanish. Includes listening, speaking, reading, and writing. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: Spanish II
Description: ContinuesSPAN 101. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: Spanish III
Description: ContinuesSPAN 102. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: Spanish for Healthcare Professionals I
Description: Spanish 113 is a course designed for students at the novice-mid/high level in Spanish (equivalent to our existingSPAN 103). Students will review grammatical structures needed to interact with patients such as asking questions, giving commands, and reporting in present and past tense. There will be a strong focus on developing oral as well as listening skills.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: Spanish IV
Description: Intermediate Spanish. Includes grammar review, listening, speaking, and reading. Recommended for students who wish to attain oral competence. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit
Prerequisites: SPAN 103 [Min Grade: D] or APWSP 331 or SPAN 113 [Min Grade: D]

Title: Spanish V
Description: ContinuesSPAN 201. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit
Prerequisites: SPAN 201 [Min Grade: D] or SPAN 211 [Min Grade: D] or APWSP 391

Title: Spanish for Healthcare Professionals II
Description: Spanish 211 is the second course in the sequence of Spanish for Health Professionals, equivalent in level of competency to our existingSPAN 201. It is designed for students with low-intermediate level of Spanish to develop the medical vocabulary, linguistics and cultural skills necessary to provide medical care to Spanish-speaking patients. Each class will be a combination of formal preparation, focused on grammatical structures and key vocabulary, and “hands on” oral practice set around the realistic dialogues that model typical conversations in doctor-patient relations.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit
Prerequisites: (SPAN 103 [Min Grade: D] or SPAN 113 [Min Grade: D])

Title: Spanish for Healthcare Professionals III
Description: SPAN 212continues 211 and provides linguistic as well as cultural knowledge in the medical field at the intermediate mid/high level in Spanish, at a level equivalent to our regular 202. Besides reviewing and practicing medical terminology in Spanish and grammatical structures commonly used in healthcare settings, students learn about different Spanish speaking groups’ cultural practices and norms with regards to health.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit
Prerequisites: (SPAN 201 [Min Grade: D] or SPAN 211 [Min Grade: D])

Title: Advanced Writing and Speaking
Description: This course provides advanced practice in written and oral communication including journalistic, professional, and creative writing. Examines contemporary cultural contexts through media and news. Taught in Spanish.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit
Prerequisites: SPAN 202 [Min Grade: D] or SPAN 212 [Min Grade: D] or APWSP 461

Title: Introduction to Language for the Professions
Description: This course provides an introduction to communication skills in areas such as contemporary business, health, and law in a culturally sensitive fashion. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in Spanish.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Introduction to Identities and Communities
Description: This course provides an introduction to the analysis of individual and collective identities, including issues of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, class, nationality, and religion. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in Spanish.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

Title: Introduction to Power and Resistance
Description: This course provides an introduction to the analysis of power relations and issues of (in)equality rooted in contemporary political and socio-economic systems. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in Spanish.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Introduction to Language, Media, and Society
Description: This course provides an introduction to the role of language and media in society, including sociolinguistics, gender, media studies, and communication. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in Spanish.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Advanced Grammar and Translation
Description: This course provides advanced grammar instruction and fosters translation and communication skills within a contemporary cultural context. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in Spanish.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Title: Advanced Studies in Language for the Professions
Description: Spanish 420 provides advanced communication skills in areas such as contemporary business, health, and law in a culturally sensitive fashion. The content ofSPAN 420may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in Spanish.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in Spanish.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits

Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 36 credits
